PerfectNetExp.abs: 民主制度（democracy）的希腊语democratia的原意，是指多数人掌握社会权利。可是，民主制度也有其暧昧之处。
...政体[mixed government]即混合了民主(democracy)(寡头)oligarchy(和君主)monarchy(制的混合政体，并有宪法约定何时采取民主)何时采取寡头(何时采取君主制，.
...民主,或,民主政治,democracy,是现代社会最常使用的字汇之一,但是它的意义与内涵却极为分歧,有人认为民主就是,多数决,是,少数服从.
cdemocracy n.1.民主,民主制 2.民主国家 democracy = demo(=people)+cra(=power权力)+-cy(名词后缀)=人民掌握权力的政治制度或国家→  n.1.民主,民主制 2.

derivation.yuyuan_name: late 16th cent.: from French démocratie, via late Latin from Greek dēmokratia, from dēmos 'the people' + -kratia 'power, rule'

entry.tran: 民主;民主制度;民主政体
entry.def: Democracy is a system of government in which people choose their rulers by voting for them in elections.

example.ex: ...the spread of democracy in Eastern Europe.
example.tran: 民主制度在东欧的传播

entry.def: A democracy is a country in which the people choose their government by voting for it.

example.ex: The new democracies face tough challenges.
example.tran: 这些新兴的民主国家面临着严峻挑战。

entry.tran: 民主管理制度;民主作风
entry.def: Democracy is a system of running organizations, businesses, and groups in which each member is entitled to vote and take part in decisions.

example.tran: 该工会对工业民主的强调

means.word_mean: 1. the political orientation of those who favor government by the people or by their elected representatives
2. a political system in which the supreme power lies in a body of citizens who can elect people to represent them
3. the doctrine that the numerical majority of an organized group can make decisions binding on the whole group

stems_affixes.word_buile: bureau政府机构+cracy统治或政体→n.官僚政治
demo人民+cracy统治或政体→n.民主政治
mobo暴民+cracy统治或政体→n.暴民统治
mono一个人+cracy统治或政体→n.独裁统治
pluto财富+cracy统治或政体→n.富豪统治
theo神+cracy统治或政体→n.神权统治

stems_affixes.value_cn: 民主的,民主主义的;民主政体的
stems_affixes.word_buile: demo人民+crat统治+ic……的→人民统治的→民主主义的
demo人民+graph写,图+ic的→用图表的方式写人民→统计人民的→人口统计的

stems_affixes.value_cn: 民主;民主政治,民主政体;民主主义
stems_affixes.word_buile: demo人民+cracy统治→人民统治→人民做主
demo人民+crat统治→[主张]人民统治[的人]→democrat
demo人民+crat统治+ism主义→人民统治的主义→民主主义
demo人民+graph写,图+y表名词,加在形容词或r结尾的单词后→人口统计学
demo人民+crat统治+ize……化→v.民主化;使民主化

Sentence.sentence: It seems very good for Harvard to honor such a high profile popularizer of the irrational…… at a time when political and religious nonsense so jeopardize the rule of reason in this allegedly enlightened democracy and around the world.
After World War Ⅱ, the academic world turned with new enthusiasm to humanistic studies, which seemed to many scholars the best way to ensure the survival of democracy.
